intro: Melothria touchanensis, commonly known as the West African sour sop or black star fruit, is a tropical vine native to West Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. The fruit has a distinctive star-shaped appearance and a tart, acidic flavor. It is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
